refnamediv.refpurpose: List of preprocessing steps perfomed on document

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This parameter can contain space separate list of steps which are perfomed prior the normal document processing. The following steps can be specified.

listitem.para: Any DocBook V4.x contained in the document is automatically converted into DocBook V5.0 markup. This step allows processing of older DocBook V4.x documents or it can be used for processing documents which mix fragments of several viarous DocBook versions.
FIXME: this step is not implemented yet. It is reserved for emerging DocBook transclusion mechanism.
User defined step which takes place before profiling.
Step which performs profiling (conditional processing). It is necessary to specify this step if parameters like FIXME: â€¦ should have efffect.
User defined step which takes place after profiling.
Support of schema based specialization as described in .
Normalization moves all title, subtitle, and titleabbrev elements inside info wrappers, creating the wrapper if necessary.
If the element being normalized has a default title (e.g., bibligraphy and glossary), the title is made explicit during normalization.
External glossaries and bibliographies (not yet!) are also copied by normalization.

refsect1.para: If more then one step is specified then they are performed in the same order as shown above.

Steps preprofile and postprofile are user defined. If they are specified the root node of document is passed to functions f:preprofile() and f:postprofile). Default behaviour of those functions is to return identical copy. Users are expected to override these functions in customization layer.
